headline: Vancouver Canucks
text: The Vancouver Canucks are the only Canadian team with a sizable fan base south of the border â€” no doubt helped by being the only team in the pacific northwest.

headline: Saskatchewan
text: With no team of their own, Saskatchewan fans tend to be split amongst the teams from bordering provinces. The Vegas Golden Knights make a strong showing too, hinting at the draw of Las Vegas.

headline: Southern Ontario
text: Competition for fans is fiercest in Ontario, one of the few places where U.S. teams have a foothold, thanks to the proximity of the Buffalo Sabres and Detroit Red Wings.

headline: Quebec Snowbirds
text: The Habs rule Quebec but thanks to snowbirds, the Florida Panthers are making inroads, particularly near Saguenay, where just over 20% of the population is 65 or older.

headline: Atlantic Fans
text: The Boston Bruins and the Toronto Maple Leafs break up what is otherwise pretty solid Habs support in the Atlantic provinces.
